skill.name: etetoolkit
skill.description: Phylogenetic tree toolkit (ETE). Tree manipulation (Newick/NHX), evolutionary event detection, orthology/paralogy, NCBI taxonomy, visualization (PDF/SVG), for phylogenomics.
skill.summary: Phylogenetic tree toolkit (ETE). Tree manipulation (Newick/NHX), evolutionary event detection, ortho...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains legitimate bioinformatics scripts for phylogenetic tree analysis. No malicious patterns detected. Scripts only process local tree files and generate visualizations without network access or credential harvesting.

content.user_title: Analyze phylogenetic trees with ETE toolkit
content.value_statement: Processing phylogenetic trees requires specialized tools and knowledge. This skill provides ready-to-use scripts and comprehensive guidance for tree manipulation, analysis, and visualization using the ETE toolkit.
actual_capabilities: Convert trees between Newick formats using CLI scripts
Reroot trees by midpoint or outgroup selection
Prune trees to specific taxa while preserving branch lengths
Generate detailed tree statistics and ASCII visualizations
Create publication-quality PNG, PDF, or SVG tree figures
Access NCBI taxonomy database for species information
Detect evolutionary events like duplications and speciations
Perform tree comparison using Robinson-Foulds distances
limitations: Only accepts valid Newick format tree files as input
Visualization may need system GUI dependencies
Does not perform tree inference from sequence data
NCBI taxonomy database download required on first use

use_cases.title: Process gene trees for analysis
use_cases.description: Convert, reroot, and prune multiple gene trees before orthology analysis or species tree inference.

use_cases.title: Validate tree files quickly
use_cases.description: Check tree statistics and generate ASCII previews to verify file integrity and topology before analysis.

use_cases.title: Create publication figures
use_cases.description: Generate high-resolution PDF or SVG tree visualizations with custom styling for manuscripts and presentations.

prompt_templates.title: Convert tree format
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the tree_operations script to convert mytree.nw from format 0 to format 1.

prompt_templates.title: Midpoint reroot
prompt_templates.prompt: Reroot the tree in unrooted.nw using midpoint method and save as rooted.nw.

prompt_templates.title: Prune to taxa
prompt_templates.prompt: Prune tree.nw to keep only human, mouse, and rat taxa, preserving branch lengths.

prompt_templates.title: Styled visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Render tree.nw to figure.pdf with circular layout, support values shown, and color nodes by support strength.

output_examples.input: Show me the statistics for my phylogenetic tree
output: Branch length statistics: mean=0.125, min=0.001, max=0.892

best_practices: Verify Newick format numbers match your analysis software requirements
Use midpoint rooting only when no reliable outgroup is available
Preserve branch lengths when pruning for phylogenetic analysis
Choose SVG or PDF formats for publication-quality figures
Install ete3 with GUI dependencies for full visualization features
anti_patterns: Running visualization scripts without installing ete3 package first
Using raster formats like JPG for publication figures
Pruning trees without preserving branch lengths in evolutionary studies

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides scripts and documentation that work across all platforms.

faq.question: What is the maximum tree size supported?
faq.answer: Large trees with thousands of leaves are supported, limited by available system memory.

faq.question: Can I integrate these scripts into my analysis pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the CLI scripts are designed for integration into shell scripts and workflow tools.

faq.question: Does the skill access or transmit my data externally?
faq.answer: No, all operations are local. Only the NCBI taxonomy feature downloads a public database.

faq.question: What if tree rendering fails with errors?
faq.answer: Install system GUI dependencies and ete3 with GUI support, then retry the operation.

faq.question: How does this compare to other phylogenetic tools?
faq.answer: ETE provides comprehensive tree analysis capabilities with Python integration and publication-quality visualization.
